title: Setting batch_cfg=True produces slightly different results
body:
Hi, I was playing around with `batch_cfg` and am seeing different results when I enable/disable batching. Is this intended behaviour?

Code to reproduce:
```py
import numpy as np
import os
from genmo.mochi_preview.pipelines import (
    DecoderModelFactory,
    DitModelFactory,
    MochiPipeline,
    T5ModelFactory,
    linear_quadratic_schedule,
)

import pickle

MOCHI_DIR = "./weights"

pipeline = MochiPipeline(
    text_encoder_factory=T5ModelFactory(),
    dit_factory=DitModelFactory(
        model_path=f"{MOCHI_DIR}/dit.safetensors", model_dtype="bf16"
    ),
    decoder_factory=DecoderModelFactory(
        model_path=f"{MOCHI_DIR}/decoder.safetensors",
    ),
    decode_type="tiled_full",
    cpu_offload=True
)

cfgs = [
    (dict(
        height=480,
        width=848,
        num_frames=31,
        num_inference_steps=64,
        sigma_schedule=linear_quadratic_schedule(64, 0.025),
        cfg_schedule=[4.5] * 64,
        batch_cfg=False,
        prompt="A spinning globe on a wooden desk.",
        negative_prompt="",
        seed=12345,
    ), "ref_unbatched.pkl"),
    (dict(
        height=480,
        width=848,
        num_frames=31,
        num_inference_steps=64,
        sigma_schedule=linear_quadratic_schedule(64, 0.025),
        cfg_schedule=[4.5] * 64,
        batch_cfg=True,
        prompt="A spinning globe on a wooden desk.",
        negative_prompt="",
        seed=12345,
    ), "ref_batched.pkl")
]

videos = []
for cfg, fname in cfgs:
    video = pipeline(**cfg)
    videos.append(video)
        
print(np.allclose(videos[0], videos[1]))
```

Note: The generated videos look roughly the same
author: Akshat-Tripathi

comments.body:
Hi @Akshat-Tripathi,

Do you have any visual examples comparing the two videos?

Some slight numerical differences are expected between batch_cfg=False and batch_cfg=True due to CUDA kernel differences in the framework.

If there's a significant difference in the videos, we'd be happy to check for a bug.

Hi @ajayjain,

Yeah I've got a few videos generated without any noticeable differences. Kernel differences does make sense as a reason thanks!

title: Web monthly credits is not resetting.
body:
### So here's the full story.

First of all, I ran out of my monthly credits in the free plan. And It just keeps saying a date over today's date saying the credits will reset in that day but it just keeps getting over and over again. For example:

If it says **The credits will reset in 16 Dec** , then when 16 Dec comes, it will say **The credits will reset in 17 Dec** and so on.
I waited over a month to see if it will go away but it does not. I hope this gets fixed. I don't know if this is just an issue on my part but can someone please help me?

Thank you.
-Creppy
author: CreppyMC

comments.body: Hi, thanks for bringing up this issue, I've shared the details with our product team. We will follow up on our discord which is the right channel for this kind of stuff :)

Hey @CreppyMC, I work on product at Genmo. Thank you for flagging this issueâ€“we've pushed out a fix that should be ready  soon. 

In the meantime, do you mind sending me your genmo username? I'd like to grant you extra generation credits for bringing this up. If you have discord, we can continue the conversation there ðŸ˜„

title: TypeError: configure_model() missing 1 required positional argument: 'cpu_offload_'
body:
TypeError: configure_model() missing 1 required positional argument: 'cpu_offload_'
start gradio
I will encounter this problem regardless of whether I pass this parameter or not
Here are some startup parameters I have tried
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/ --cpu_offload true
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/ --cpu_offload false
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/
author: ysxk

comments.body: Hi @ysxk, this is a bug introduced by our LoRA trainer. I'm working on a fix which should be out soon. In the meantime, `./demos/cli.py` works. Thanks for reporting!

@ysxk gradio_ui.py is now fixed. You can use it with:
```
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/ --cpu_offload
```
or
```
python3 ./demos/gradio_ui.py --model_dir weights/
```
thanks

Good catch! Thanks for adding.

@ajayjain confirming that this PR is helpful.

title: Add path for t5 model
body:
Hey :)
Thank you for your work! I added path to t5 model, because do not want to load one more T5 if I have one :)

Example using:
```python
MOCHI_DIR =  "/workspace/hf_cache/mochi"
T5_DIR = "/workspace/hf_cache/t5-v1_1-xxl"

pipeline = MochiSingleGPUPipeline(
    text_encoder_factory=T5ModelFactory(
        model_dir=T5_DIR
    ),
    dit_factory=DitModelFactory(
        model_path=f"{MOCHI_DIR}/dit.safetensors", 
        model_dtype="bf16"
    ),
    decoder_factory=DecoderModelFactory(
        model_path=f"{MOCHI_DIR}/decoder.safetensors",
    ),
    cpu_offload=True,
    decode_type="tiled_full"
)
```
or just as your example in readme.

Tested on A100

title: VAE Fourier feature
body:
Good job!
We found that the settings in vae are start=6, stop=8 to get w = torch.pow(2.0, freqs) * (2 * torch.pi) , what is the special meaning of this frequency? When we train vae, do we add frequency domain features to the video before feeding it into the model?
author: GooThinker

comments.body: Checkout `test_encoder_decoder.py` to see how to use the fourier features. @ajayjain what's the reasoning behind these constants?

The VAE is trained with those constants, so you should keep using those specific values. It's also important to compute those features in float32, not quantized.

The fourier features help the encoder see fine-grained differences in pixel values. For example, a neural network might struggle to differentiate a pixel with color 254 versus 255, and the frequencies provided by the fourier features make the difference more obvious.

ok, fixed it

> ok, fixed it

How did you fix it?
Any updates on solving genmo.lib?

> > ok, fixed it
> 
> How did you fix it?

i did open a pr with the fix, but basically, it happens because either the path is not added correctly (adding .. to path is dependent on the directory you are curently in) and because even if the path is added the lib should be referenced as src.genmo

Thanks, I just solved it too after I realized that "your-dir" from python3 ./demos/cli.py --model_dir your-dir has to be the full path, it cannot include any wildcards or placeholders. Perhaps a Readme clarification would help?

To resolve the issue, please copy the __init__.py file to both the genmo directory and the genmo/lib directory. 
Additionally, make sure to move the demo/cli.py file under the src directory. This should help in fixing the problem.
after cloning the repo run `pip install -ve .` inside `models` folder to fix `No module named 'genmo'` issue.

Hi gjnave, did you use `uv pip install click` instead of `pip install click`, if you're using uv as we suggested?
If not, can you show us the exact command you used and the error message?

title: text encoders
body:
I dont see any code (inside this branch\fork) which download and store T5 model and encoders

May be i am dumb but please show me where (in which .py file) hf_hub_download or wget are used

I see T5_MODEL = "google/t5-v1_1-xxl"  and dont see how it is dowloaded with code
author: ptits

comments.body:
Just follow the chain of function calls.
The model is downloaded by T5Tokenizer.from_pretrained() / T5EncoderModel.from_pretrained() from the transformers library, which will then eventually download the model using the huggingface_hub library.
Check your site-packages if you want to see the code.

title: TypeError: AsymmetricAttention.__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'clip_feat_dim'
author: cene555

comments.body: Hi! Thanks for trying out the inference repo. Can you provide the dit-config.yaml you used to run the model?

Hi, you can simple fix the error by deleting the unexpected keyworks from the dit-config.yaml. For me, I have deleted the `clip_feat_dim`, `pooled_caption_mlp_bias` and `use_transformer_engine` from dit-config.yaml and everything works fine. I guess its a mismatch between the ckpt on huggingface and the codebase.
If you pull the latest version of this repository, this error should be gone @cene555.

title: Great work! Will you release the training code?
author: yachty66

comments.body:
Hi Yachty,

This is an inference-focused library initially for simplicity. We released a full model definition including our causal VAE and context parallel inference so you could try to implement a tuning loop. It's a bit computationally intensive to pre-train at the moment.
